t: Luke 6
Jesus Is Lord of the Sabbath
Now*p it happened on the second Sabbath after the first that He went through the grainfields. And His disciples plucked the heads of grain and ate them,*i rubbing them*i in their*i hands.
And some of the Pharisees said to them, “Why are you doing what is not lawful to do on the Sabbath?”
But*p Jesus answering them said, “Have*r you*r not*r even*r read*r this,*r what*r David*r did*r when*r he*r was*r hungry,*r he*r and*r those*r who*r were*r with*r him:*r

how*r he*r went*r into*r the*r house*r of*r God,*r took*r and*r ate*r the*r showbread,*r and*r also*r gave*r some*r to*r those*r with*r him,*r which*r is*r not*r lawful*r for*r any*r but*r the*r priests*r to*r eat?”*r
And He said to them, “The*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r also*r Lord*r of*r the*r Sabbath.”*r
Healing on the Sabbath
Now*p it happened on another Sabbath, also, that He entered the synagogue and taught. And a man was there whose right hand was withered.
So the scribes and Pharisees watched Him closely, whether He would heal on the Sabbath, that they might find an accusation against Him.
But He knew their thoughts, and said to the man who had the withered hand, “Arise*r and*r stand*r here.”*r And he arose and stood.
Then Jesus said to them, “I*r will*r ask*r you*r one*r thing:*r Is*r it*r lawful*r on*r the*r Sabbath*r to*r do*r good*r or*r to*r do*r evil,*r to*r save*r life*r or*r to*r destroy?”*r
And when He had looked around at them all, He said to the man, “Stretch*r out*r your*r hand.”*r And he did so, and his hand was restored as whole as the other.
But they were filled with rage, and discussed with one another what they might do to Jesus.
The Twelve Apostles
Now*p it came to pass in those days that He went out to the mountain to pray, and continued all night in prayer to God.
And when it was day, He called His disciples to Himself;*i and from them He chose twelve whom He also named apostles:
Simon, whom He also named Peter, and Andrew his brother; James and John; Philip and Bartholomew;
Matthew and Thomas; James the son*i of Alphaeus, and Simon called the Zealot;
Judas the*i son*i of James, and Judas Iscariot who also became a traitor.
Jesus Heals a Great Multitude

And*p He came down with them and stood on a level place with a crowd of His disciples and a great multitude of people from all Judea and Jerusalem, and from the seacoast of Tyre and Sidon, who came to hear Him and be healed of their diseases,
as well as those who were tormented with unclean spirits. And they were healed.
And the whole multitude sought to touch Him, for power went out from Him and healed them*i all.
The Beatitudes
Then*p He lifted up His eyes toward His disciples, and said: “Blessed*rpn are*ir you*ir poor,*r For*rld yours*r is*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.*r
Blessed*rld are*ir you*ir who*r hunger*r now,*r For*rld you*r shall*r be*r filled.*r Blessed*rld are*ir you*ir who*r weep*r now,*r For*rld you*r shall*r laugh.*r

Blessed*rld are*r you*r when*r men*r hate*r you,*r And*rld when*r they*r exclude*r you,*r And*rld revile*r you,*ir and*r cast*r out*r your*r name*r as*r evil,*r For*rld the*r Son*r of*r Man’s*r sake.*r
Rejoice*rld in*r that*r day*r and*r leap*r for*r joy!*r For*rld indeed*r your*r reward*r is*ir great*r in*r heaven,*r For*rld in*r like*r manner*r their*r fathers*r did*r to*r the*r prophets.*r

“But*rpn woe*r to*r you*r who*r are*r rich,*r For*rld you*r have*r received*r your*r consolation.*r
Woe*rld to*r you*r who*r are*r full,*r For*rld you*r shall*r hunger.*r Woe*rld to*r you*r who*r laugh*r now,*r For*rld you*r shall*r mourn*r and*r weep.*r
Woe*rld to*r you*r when*r all*r men*r speak*r well*r of*r you,*r For*rld so*r did*r their*r fathers*r to*r the*r false*r prophets.*r
Love Your Enemies
“But*rp I*r say*r to*r you*r who*r hear:*r Love*r your*r enemies,*r do*r good*r to*r those*r who*r hate*r you,*r
bless*r those*r who*r curse*r you,*r and*r pray*r for*r those*r who*r spitefully*r use*r you.*r
To*r him*r who*r strikes*r you*r on*r the*r one*ir cheek,*r offer*r the*r other*r also.*r And*r from*r him*r who*r takes*r away*r your*r cloak,*r do*r not*r withhold*r your*ir tunic*r either.*r
Give*r to*r everyone*r who*r asks*r of*r you.*r And*r from*r him*r who*r takes*r away*r your*r goods*r do*r not*r ask*r them*ir back.*r
And*r just*r as*r you*r want*r men*r to*r do*r to*r you,*r you*r also*r do*r to*r them*r likewise.*r
“But*rp if*r you*r love*r those*r who*r love*r you,*r what*r credit*r is*r that*r to*r you?*r For*r even*r sinners*r love*r those*r who*r love*r them.*r
And*r if*r you*r do*r good*r to*r those*r who*r do*r good*r to*r you,*r what*r credit*r is*r that*r to*r you?*r For*r even*r sinners*r do*r the*r same.*r

And*r if*r you*r lend*r to*ir those*ir from*r whom*r you*r hope*r to*r receive*r back,*r what*r credit*r is*r that*r to*r you?*r For*r even*r sinners*r lend*r to*r sinners*r to*r receive*r as*r much*r back.*r

But*r love*r your*r enemies,*r do*r good,*r and*r lend,*r hoping*r for*r nothing*r in*r return;*r and*r your*r reward*r will*r be*r great,*r and*r you*r will*r be*r sons*r of*r the*r Most*r High.*r For*r He*r is*r kind*r to*r the*r unthankful*r and*r evil.*r
Therefore*r be*r merciful,*r just*r as*r your*r Father*r also*r is*r merciful.*r
Do Not Judge
“Judge*rp not,*r and*r you*r shall*r not*r be*r judged.*r Condemn*r not,*r and*r you*r shall*r not*r be*r condemned.*r Forgive,*r and*r you*r will*r be*r forgiven.*r

A*r disciple*r is*r not*r above*r his*r teacher,*r but*r everyone*r who*r is*r perfectly*r trained*r will*r be*r like*r his*r teacher.*r
And*r why*r do*r you*r look*r at*r the*r speck*r in*r your*r brother’s*r eye,*r but*r do*r not*r perceive*r the*r plank*r in*r your*r own*r eye?*r

Or*r how*r can*r you*r say*r to*r your*r brother,*r ‘Brother,*r let*r me*r remove*r the*r speck*r that*r is*ir in*r your*r eye,’*r when*r you*r yourself*r do*r not*r see*r the*r plank*r that*r is*ir in*r your*r own*r eye?*r Hypocrite!*r First*r remove*r the*r plank*r from*r your*r own*r eye,*r and*r then*r you*r will*r see*r clearly*r to*r remove*r the*r speck*r that*r is*r in*r your*r brother’s*r eye.*r
A Tree Is Known by Its Fruit
“For*rp a*r good*r tree*r does*r not*r bear*r bad*r fruit,*r nor*r does*r a*r bad*r tree*r bear*r good*r fruit.*r
For*r every*r tree*r is*r known*r by*r its*r own*r fruit.*r For*r men*ir do*r not*r gather*r figs*r from*r thorns,*r nor*r do*r they*r gather*r grapes*r from*r a*r bramble*r bush.*r

A*r good*r man*r out*r of*r the*r good*r treasure*r of*r his*r heart*r brings*r forth*r good;*r and*r an*r evil*r man*r out*r of*r the*r evil*r treasure*r of*r his*r heart*r brings*r forth*r evil.*r For*r out*r of*r the*r abundance*r of*r the*r heart*r his*r mouth*r speaks.*r
Build on the Rock
“But*rp why*r do*r you*r call*r Me*r ‘Lord,*r Lord,’*r and*r not*r do*r the*r things*r which*r I*r say?*r
Whoever*r comes*r to*r Me,*r and*r hears*r My*r sayings*r and*r does*r them,*r I*r will*r show*r you*r whom*r he*r is*r like:*r

He*r is*r like*r a*r man*r building*r a*r house,*r who*r dug*r deep*r and*r laid*r the*r foundation*r on*r the*r rock.*r And*r when*r the*r flood*r arose,*r the*r stream*r beat*r vehemently*r against*r that*r house,*r and*r could*r not*r shake*r it,*r for*r it*r was*r founded*r on*r the*r rock.*r
